inn1.comm: bowls it on middle stump channel, Tamim taps it to midwicket
bowls it on middle stumps, blocked
tossed up outside off, driven back to the bowler
defends and the ball goes on the bounce to slip
Tamim drives it to mid-off gently
drifting in from outside off, gets forward and defends to the off side

length ball but fired on the pads, tucked away to midwicket, Rashid Khan runs across from deep square leg and slides it pull it back, they go upstairs to check if he has made contact with the ropes. It's tough and go and replays show that he has just about managed to avoid contact
Tamim defends it to mid-off
sprays it down the leg side
gets his foot across and tucks it to backward square leg
short of a length on leg stump channel, tucks it very fine and Rashid Khan once again puts in the dive and pulls it back before the ropes
poor delivery. It's full and angled across, bowled right on the pads, easily clipped away off the pads to the open deep midwicket region, uses the angle to his advantage and times it well
back of a length and angled across, left alone outside off

drops a sitter. Short ball, Tamim tries to pull and he miscues it. Gets it horribly wrong as it bounces more than he anticipated and gets big on him. Gets a top edge and Stanikzai spills a sitter at mid-on as he tries to catch it with his fingers pointing up
defended back to the bowler
gets forward and defends to covers
tossed up outside off,  gets forward and drives to covers
flighted outside off, gets forward and glides it past the cordon to third man for a boundary
comes forward and drives to long-off
looks to come forward and defend but gets an inside edge and the ball goes to square leg
trickles it down to third man
good length outside off, holds its line, defended to covers
good length but on leg stump channel, tucks it to midwicket and thinks of a single but the fielder there puts in the dive and they decide against it
shaping away outside off, gets forward and drops it in front of point and takes off for a quick single
fuller and on the fifth stump channel, punches it firmly to covers, can't pierce the gap there
tucks it to backward square leg
backs away and defends it to the off side
flat ball that is bowled close to the stumps, played to midwicket
beautifully done! Entices the batsman with a loopy delivery outside off that spins away sharply, Sarkar gets forward and sticks his bat out but the ball spins past the outside edge and he is beaten
pushed through quicker on the stumps, defended easily
tries to defend and the ball goes off the outer half of the bat towards the cordon
starts off with a full and wide delivery, Tamim gets forward and lets it go
short and wide, Tamim slaps it and there is a shout of catch it. Gets it well wide of point and the ball goes towards the boundary. Man there in the deep, so they only get one
pitched up and shaping away, comes forward and looks to push, walks into the shot as he does so and gets an outside edge as the ball goes away towards third man
good length on middle and leg, tucks it off the pads to square leg

wildly slashes at one and it is edged to the wicketkeeper. It's short and wide and Sarkar chases at it. That was nowhere close to him and it had good bounce on it. Gets a thick edge that is held easily by the wicketkeeper
good length ball outside off, gets solidly behind it and blocks
floats it and attacks the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
shifts back in his crease and tucks it around the corner
flighted on middle and leg, clipped away to square leg
pushed through slightly flatter on off and middle, tucked away
loopy delivery outside off, tries to defend and the ball goes off the outside part of the bat towards point
spins back in from off and middle, tucked with the turn behind square. It's packed there, so no run possible
very full and down the leg side, clipped off the toes through deep midwicket. Can't be bowling there
terrific response from the bowler. Angles it across and gets it on a length, Tamim pushes forward and sticks his bat out and the ball shapes away past his outside edge
gets a long way across and bunts it to the off side
full and on the fifth stump channel, holds its line, gets forward and drives it past the diving mid-off fielder

poor delivery to follow up. Bowls it too full, almost a full toss down the leg side, Tamim dabs it gently through mid-on, uses the pace on that delivery and just manages to pick the gap between mid-on and midwicket
very full and outside off, gets across and nails the drive but it's hit straight to cover

beautiful delivery. Good length outside off, sticks his bat out from the crease and the ball hisses past the outside edge, nips back in very late and Shahzad goes up after collecting it but there was no edge. Very close though
defended to mid-on
bangs it in outside off and pushes him back, Sabbir jumps back to the backfoot and defends
fuller ball, holding its line outside off, Sabbir is sure of his offstump and lets it go
width on offer, Sabbir hops in to the backfoot and opens the face of his bat as he splits the gap at point. Third man runs across and makes a diving effort to pull it back
full and outside off, nipping back in late, punched firmly to mid-off
short and wide, slapped but straight to cover point
full and angling away just outside off, gets forward and pushes but the ball goes off the inside half of the bat back to the bowler
fuller ball, on leg stump channel, pushes it to mid-on
fires it full in the corridor outside off, gets it off the inside part of the bat back past the right of the bowler
length ball outside off, Sabbir is kept on the backfoot and defends and the ball goes off the inside part of the bat back to the bowler
full and wide, stays in the crease and drops it in front of point
tries to defend on the front foot to the off side but the ball goes off the inside edge to backward square leg
beaten. Comes down the track and the bowler drags his length back. Swipes blindly across the line and makes no contact

lucky boundary. Goes for the pull shot but no way that was short enough to pull that off. It was on a length outside off, gets a thick edge and the ball shoots over the wicketkeeper's head and runs away to the boundary

pulled again and this time he nails it. Got it on the right line and length. It was short enough and Sabbir times it to perfection. Didn't try to hit it too hard and the ball goes clean over the backward square leg fence
good length outside off, tries to fend it off to the off side and misses
slower ball, full toss outside off, plays it carefully to covers
short of a length and shaping away from the left-hander, cut away and the ball goes down to third man off the outside edge
good length outside off, opens the face of his bat and glides it down to third man
tucked to midwicket
very full on middle stump channel, defended to the right of the bowler

slogs across the line and finds the mid-on fence. It was full and outside off and Sabbir decides to fetch it from outside off and gives it a good whack as the ball sails over the outstretched hands of the mid-on fielder
good length outside off, presents the full face of his bat and defends to covers
full toss outside off, driven to covers where Nabi fields it cleanly. But the throw is wayward and nobody is backing up
pushed down to long-on
floated up on leg stump, turns it away to backward square leg
plants his front foot across and tucks it past mid-on
comes forward and defends to the off side
turns it from outside off, tucked around the corner
beauty! Pushed through quicker outside off, bounces and gets big on the batsman who goes to the backfoot and looks to defend but the bat is inside the line and he doesn't meet the ball
floated up on leg stump, pushed down to long-on
slightly shorter, tucked off the hips to deep midwicket
looks to back away and cut it away to third man but he gets too far away from it and can't make contact
wrong'un that spins back in sharply and bounces, picks it up early and bunts it down the pitch off the backfoot
short ball, pulled to deep midwicket
comes down the track to get to the pitch if it and keep the turn to a minimum, lofts it clean over the region between long-on and deep midwicket. Timed superbly
short and wide ball, backs away and slaps it to sweeper cover
gives it too much air and bowls a full toss outside off, Tamim gladly accepts it and drives it through covers
gives it some air outside off, pushes it towards mid-off
tucked off the pads to the leg side
flighted on leg stump, gets forward and blocks quietly
sticks to the leg stump channel, clipped off the toes to backward square leg
flatter and shorter, some width also on offer, slaps it down to wide long-off
tries to flick it to the leg side but wears it on the pad and the ball goes behind square
pushed through quicker and flatter, presses forward and pushes it in front of point and gets through for a sharp single
fired on the pads again, tucked to the leg side
flat and short outside off, backs away and stabs it to sweeper cover
short and wide again, protection at the sweeper cover fence so it is cut off as the batsman rocks back and slaps it away
late adjustment. It was short and coming in. Tamim backs away but it sharply spins into him, uses his wrists to deftly guide it past point
keeps bowling it short and it is slapped away to sweeper cover
shifts across in his crease and dabs it down to backward square leg
loopy fuller ball, comes forward and defends
googly. Tamim backs away but the ball follows him after landing, so he uses opens the face of his bat and steers it away towards third man
tucked to deep midwicket
comes forward and smothers the spin
presses forward and defends but the ball lands on a good length region and spins past the outside edge. He was nowhere close to that
comes forward and bunts it to covers
couldn't have asked for an easier delivery first up after drinks. Juicy full toss on the pads, flicked straight to square leg
flicked with the spin to midwicket
excellent stop off his own bowling, it was firmly struck
wrong-un which he rocks back to ease it wide of point to bring up his 34th ODI fifty
tight line, at length on off stump, defended off the back foot

has connected the slog quite superbly. Fetched it from outside off, didn't quite get to the pitch but still managed to hit it off the middle. Split the gap perfectly between deep midwicket and long-on
hint of width outside off, steered down to third man for a comfortable single
looks to improvise by walking outside the crease and swing across the line but the bowler adjusts well to bang it in short, defended back down the pitch
slower delivery angled into middle and leg from wide of the crease, the ball got stuck into the pitch and got to him late, Sabbir is hit on the thigh pad as he was through with the attempted whip
play and a miss. The width was there for him to cut, but was a split-second late on it again.
looks to angle it behind point, but hits it straight to the fielder. Tight over so far, important to finish well
stays inside the crease and defends the incoming length ball to the off side

appeal for caught behind, but umpire signals that as wide. Shahzad, the wicketkeeper, is signalling to the umpire that it perhaps touch the pad.  Why did he appeal then?  Perhaps didn't realise that he'd been trapped there
too full on the pads, he gets down on one knee and paddles it down to fine leg
gets to the pitch of the ball and works it down the ground to long-on for an easy single

he's picking his spots so easily. Once again the intent was there, as he swung across the line with the spin to split the gap at cow corner. Nothing fancy, just pure timing. They're picking boundaries from time-to-time
eased to the point region

went across the line to swipe it over deep midwicket, ended up getting a thick inside-edge onto the pad. Wonder why he'd try that? There was a boundary rider placed specifically for that stroke earlier in the over
another slog, mistimes a flat hit to mid-on this time
angles a full-length delivery on middle, Tamim dead bats that back down the pitch
firm push down to long-off for an easy single
cleverly done, it's the delicate dab down to third man this time
worked off his pads into the gap at deep square leg
slower and fuller outside off, driven straight to extra cover
lucky break . Looks to play a short-arm jab, but the ball hurries onto him and skews up towards mid-on, just eludes Rashid Khan
uppish, but falls short of cover. Rocked back and slapped that off the back foot
makes a bit of room and chops that into the gap towards deep point

slow turn back into middle and leg but a touch too short, he turns it towards square leg who attempts to parry the ball towards the midwicket fielder. Except that the midwicket fielder wasn't in position to stop that since he was rushing towards his mate
worked off his hip behind square on the leg side as they jog across for a single
too short again, there's ample time and width for him to rock back and crack that down to deep point
up in the air but just manages to beat the man at short third man. Deep point has some work to do and he does well to run around to cut that off. Looked like a tired shot from Tamim.
driven up over the infield, down to sweeper cover
gets a thick inside edge onto the pad as he looks to play an off-drive down to long-off
driven on the up towards sweeper cover, made a crunching sound as ball made contact with the bat
slices it down to third man. Shaped to drive but the bat face was left open. A gully fielder would have gobbled that up
dabs it gently onto the off side and scampers across for a quick single
worked off his wrists to short fine leg, quick single taken again
slow turn into middle and leg, he uses the depth of the crease to work it down to deep midwicket
makes a bit of room and drives him inside-out with the spin to long-off
gets onto the back foot and punches a short ball to deep midwicket
gives him the charge and drills a tossed up delivery to cover
sensibly done this time. Goes back to work it to deep square
gets across the stumps, not sure if he was shaping for a swipe across the line. But the ball was fired into middle and leg, he then adjusted to turn it straight to short fine
beaten by a googly that skids across quickly before Tamim could get down to dab that wide of slip
this one skids on from length around off stump, chopped behind the wicket
not much room to cut, chopped away to short third man. Rahmat misfields, but it would have been a single irrespective
beaten on the drive. Invited him to play the stroke but the drift and sharp turn away nearly did Sabbir in.
squared up by a beauty that breaks away sharply from off stump. This was a lot flatter and shorter, Sabbir had no clue
overcompensates by sliding this into the pad, worked to deep midwicket
sweeps and misses. Didn't get underneath the flight of the quicker delivery
gets outside the line of the stumps and sweeps that to deep square

you can pay good money if you're guaranteed strokes like that. Tamim sashays down the pitch, opens up the off side and goes inside-out with the spin over extra cover, one bounce into the boundary. Beautifully done
he sees him giving the charge and fires it into middle and leg, turned wide of midwicket

drifting down leg, he gets down on one knee and plays a rocket sweep that beats deep backward square leg. Sabbir has justified his promotion to No.3. This has been an assured fifty that gives Bangladesh healthy options going forward. Now for them to build from here. 3rd ODI fifty for him
punched down to long-on for an easy single
driven straight to cover. There wasn't much turn on that
wrong'un that cuts back in, was a touch short so Sabbir adjusted to play it back down the pitch
beaten by sharp turn. Drift and then some fizz off the pitch from off stump
draws him forward and then has him beaten. This was bowled a lot slower through the air.

Mirwais has made a royal mess of that at deep cover.  This was cracked off the back foot. Mirwais did all the hard work by running around the ropes, but looked like an attempted flick back to his partner giving it chase from the infield went wrong.
gets a thick edge to short third man
gets forward and accounts for the dip to defend
worked to the man at midwicket again, no chance of a single
nicely tossed up on middle, he gets forward and eases it back to the bowler
looked to force that wide of midwicket, gets a thick inside-edge that deflects to the off side as they complete a quick single
worked wide of the man at mid-on for an easy single. Was short, so he had enough time to get back and work the ball into the gap

steps out, gets to the pitch of the ball and blasts it over the bowler's head. He was mindful of the wide long-on fielder, but the decision to go a lot straighter did the trick as he managed to beat the man there.
too predictable with his googlies, worked with the spin to deep square leg

half-tracker on middle, it was sitting up nicely for Tamim to rock back, open up the leg side and hammer the pull into the gap at deep midwicket. He seems to be in his elements. The crowd goes wild. Is this a sign that he's going to cut loose?
fires a quicker delivery on middle, pushed to cover
makes a bit of room and punches the short ball straight to cover point
appeal for lbw but the ball was drifting down leg, Tamim can't get any bat on a neat little nurdle towards short fine

a delicious 'hit me' ball on middle. Tamim gleefully accepts it as he rocks back and plays a forceful pull into the deep midwicket boundary. He is disappointed that he couldn't connect that for six, but it's runs nonetheless.

delightful swing of the bat to send the ball soaring over deep midwicket. He didn't get to the pitch of the ball. To make matters a little tougher, he was hitting across the line, but none of that mattered as the bat swing helped him generate the timing and power. Crowd has gone wild
mistimes a drive to cover

the party is over. Sabbir has thrown it away, and so Rahmat has the last laugh. Credit to the bowler, who wasn't afraid to toss the ball up despite being hit for a six. Sabbir once again went for a big heave, but was beaten by the drift and turn as he managed to top edge the slog straight to short third man. End of an excellent partnership. Afghanistan's reaction seemed to suggest they were relieved, and not elated
is made to stretch forward as he plays it back to the bowler
worked with the spin to midwicket, tumbling stop by Nabi
strokes it down to long-on to get off the mark
driven firmly down the ground. Once it beats mid-off, there's no chance on this lightning fast outfield. Delightful stroke really, straight bat, super timing
backs away to cut that to deep cover. Lucky to get away with that long hop
eased past the bowler to long-on as they jog the single
can't get underneath the flight, squeezes the attempted drive to cover
punched wide of midwicket, good stop by Nabi but that can't prevent the single
dragged across the line towards long-on, got a thick inside edge too as he looked to go over the top
deft touch and he nearly got full value for that, short third man does well to sprint and pull it back in
lunges forward and defends
too short, he makes a bit of room and forces that cut shot behind point. Too easy. He's revving up the engine here
forced off the back foot to extra cover
gets across the stumps to paddle it fine towards the boundary
a misfield at cover gives them an easy single. Tamim will keep strike and the crowd's cheer only grows bigger
flatter delivery on middle, defended back down the pitch
gets forward and eases it back to the bowler
worked past the bowler to long-on
punched past the bowler, long-on comes around again to stop that
looks for a quick single, but the mid-off fielder is quick to come in to stop that. Shakib wasn't keen on the run
swung across the line towards deep midwicket
excellent stop at short cover prevents the single, it was struck firmly
opens the bat face late to angle an away-going delivery down to third man
Shakib uses the depth of the crease to defend that short ball back to the bowler
driven on the up to the man at cover this time
shapes to cut but is beaten by the fizz on that delivery. Extra bounce? Was late on the stroke
pulled to the man at deep fine leg
driven back firmly to the bowler, didn't have much room to work with
goes onto the back foot to dead bat that
pushed through quicker on middle, played back to the bowler again
fires one down the leg side in anticipation of the batsman giving him the charge, easy call for the umpire
leans forward and drives to cover
opens the bat face late to ease it past the infield toward deep cover
leans forward and drives that into the gap at deep cover. The cheer gets bigger, Tamim is on 99 but they'll have to wait for a couple of minutes

there's the moment Tamim has waited a while for. He was denied in the first ODI but not this time. Gently works the ball to the on side and scampers through to complete his century.  Super knock in a grand finale will give him immense satisfaction . Runs across to high-give Shakib followed by a big bear hug.
camps back to block that delivery
beaten as he swings wild to a length ball angling across. Didn't pick the length at all this time
defended back to the bowler off the back foot
mistimes a pull, but fortunately for him it lands short of the fine leg fielder
gets to the pitch of the ball and chips it over the infield, long-on comes around to cut that off, they complete the second quite easily
fires it down the leg side, Shahzad misses with the flick and Shahzad goes up in a light-hearted appeal behind the stumps
gets forward and gently nudges it back to the bowler
targets midwicket and launches one over the region. It's a cross-batted heave and the ball sails to the boundary on the bounce, beats the fielder who puts in the dive
advances down the track and heaves it over midwicket, even better connection this time as the ball carries all the way over the boundary hoardings

goes inside-out over extra cover this time. Advances down and makes room for himself as he does so before carting it over the in-field on the off side, the ball goes all the way towards the Bangladesh team dugout
mighty close. Goes for a wild slog over midwicket and misses it completely, could have lost his stumps there
stays in the crease and defends
times a crisp cover drive that is stopped brilliantly by the man guarding the area
width on offer, cuts it square of the wicket and it is cut off at deep point
bowls it wide outside off, works it to cover

tries to go big down the ground and holes out to long-off. Got the timing wrong and long-off runs a few inches to his left to snaffle an easy catch. Superb knock from Tamim, he has really set it up for Bangladesh. Can they finish strongly?
stabs it to point, no run there
quicker off the pitch, Shakib is rushed but manages to keep it out
Mushfiqur pulls it to deep square-leg
struck on the front pad but no appeal, it was heading down leg
Shakib misses one that is sliding down, Shahzad misses it too
driven down to mid-off
tucked to fine leg
trickles it down to deep point
flighted on middle and off, comes down the track and pushes it to long-on
tucked to midwicket
pushed through quicker and flatter, Mushfiqur hastily backs away and stabs it towards point
pushes him back with one that is pushed through quicker, Shakib jams it back to the bowler off the backfoot
flighted outside off, advances down the track and eases it to long-on
flighted on the pads, clipped around the corner behind square on the leg side

Dawlat Zadran miscues a catch to deep square leg, it was a full toss that was angled in, Rahim gets down and sweeps uppishly. Dawlat tries to get around it but he seems to be indecisive on whether to go for the catch or to stop the boundary as the ball dips down on him, does neither as he slides down and the ball escapes past him
defended to the off side
tucked to deep midwicket
tries to nudge it behind, square leg cuts it off
runs it away to sweeper cover
bounces more than he anticipates and gets big on him, Rahim backs away and negotiates it and the ball goes back to the bowler

nicks a full and wide ball that is held by Shahzad. Pushed across to the left-hander and Shakib goes after it without moving his feet much, opens the face of his bat as he looks to run it down to third man, gets an outside edge for his troubles
fired down leg, looks to tuck it away but wears it on the pad and the ball goes behind the stumps, wicketkeeper runs a few inches to his left and gathers it
wide outside off, looks to slice and gets an outside edge to third man
good length outside off, gets forward and blocks it to covers
short of a length, angling in, looks to flick but gets an edge and the ball goes uppishly to square leg. The fielder at midwicket runs across but the ball drops short of him
short and wide, cut away to sweeper cover

loopy delivery that was angled in, Rahim plays for the googly but it is a regular legbreak. Spins away after landing and hits him bang in front of middle stump as he makes no contact on the flick. Umpire takes little time to raise his finger. That was plumb
fires it down the leg side
short ball and Mosaddek watches it closely. Picks the length up early and pulls it away to deep midwicket
loopy delivery that straightens late, tries to flick it against the turn but makes no contact
pushed through quicker outside off, turning away, beaten

deceives him with flight and bowls a googly. It was floated up nicely and drew the batsman forward who was looking to work it with the turn to the off side. Doesn't pick the variation and the ball beats him. His foot comes out as he was looking to push at it on the front foot and Shahzad whips the bails off in a jiffy
pushes it through quicker across the left-hander, spins back in and Mosharraf is rapped on the pads as he comes forward and looks to defend, not given. The impact was outside off
hits the blockhole outside off, squeezed out to mid-off
short of a length outside off, opens the face of his bat and runs it down to third man
bouncer on the stumps, good bounce on it, so Mosharraf easily ducks under
similar bouncer and this one bounces even more, comfortably ducked under

short ball again, looks to clear his front leg and makes room before pulling. There was no width, however, and he is cramped for room. Gets a top edge on the shot and the ball hardly travels. Fortunately for Mosharraf, it falls down in no man's land in the midwicket region
fired down the leg side, Mahmudullah misses the flick
full and nipping back in late on off stump, taps it just wide of mid-off and takes off for a quick single
presses forward to defend but is rapped on the pads by a googly, they don't appeal as the impact is outside off
taps it to the vacant cover region and they take an easy single
pushed across outside off, gets across and pushes it to covers

beautifully bowled. Draws him forward with his flight and the batsman obliges. Gets forward to defend but the ball spins away viciously after pitching on the good length region. Shahzad whips the bails off and they go upstairs to check for the stumping. But his foot never came off and he is safe
pushed through quicker and spinning away sharply outside off, beaten as he pokes at it
floated up outside off, this time the batsman is able to come forward comfortably and bunt it to the off side

looks like it slipped out of his hand. Bowls it way high, but fortunately, it was well wide of the batsman and he wasn't in any danger. He tries the ramp shot after backing away. It's a feeble attempt and he can't get bat to ball. Shahzad fails to collect it cleanly behind the stumps and they steal a bye
back of a length, advances down the ground early and swipes, can't get hold of it and the ball goes to mid-on
backs away and looks to go big over the off side, beaten
fires it down the leg side
backs away and looks to pull but it's a slower ball and he is through with the shot early, can't make any contact
full and close to off, tries to stay in the creas and run it down to third man by opening the face of his bat, is beaten
goes for a pull shot again but he is in no position to play that shot. It is pacy and bounces more than his liking and he is beate again
finally makes contact on the pull shot and gets it to deep square leg
tries to flick it away and gets a leading edge. It's very mild and goes to the bowler on the bounce
backs away to make room and the bowler follows him by firing it quick and on the leg side, gets an outside edge on the slap and the ball goes towards third man
short ball, not enough on width and Mahmudullah uppishly slaps it away for a single

Mosharraf's pained stay comes to an end. Not a particularly memorable comeback for him. Backs away again and the bowler follows him. But instead of targeting the off side, he lofts it with the inward angle and goes over long-on. There is a fielder there and it is straight down his throat. Didn't have to move an inch to catch that
much-needed boundary for Bangladesh. It's wide outside off and Mahmudullah fetches it from there and nails a powerful slog through deep midwicket
tries to go big over the off as he charges down but gets an outside edge that beats the diving point fielder and runs away to third man boundary

full and outside off, tries to open the face of his bat and run it down to third man. The ball goes to the wicketkeeper and there is a noise. Shahzad goes up immediately and can't believe it when the umpire says not out. Was that probably the bat hitting the ground? Replays indicate there could have been a slight edge
short ball outside off, has to reach out for it and plays it to cover by raising his bat, that was a pedestrian shot
full and outside off, clears his front leg and slogs powerfully through cow corner
advances down the track and the bowler adjusts by firing it short and wide, manages to slap it away to sweeper cover
short ball, thinks of a ramp shot but withdraws his bat after seeing the height of that bouncer, called a wide

full and wide, Mashrafe had backed away and swiped and the ball goes off the toe end of the bat to mid-off. Mahmudullah wants a single and takes off but he is sent back by Mahmudullah. He had covered almost two-thirds of the distance. Mid-off throws to the bowler gently but he misses the bounce and fails to collect it. They take the overthrow

pulled away to deep square leg. Miscommunication again as Mashrafe wants the second run. They hesitate and the throw is at the bowler's end. He collects cleanly and fires a throw at the striker's end but misses the stumps. Shahzad doesn't get down and tries to bring his legs together to stop the ball which sneaks between his legs away to the boundary
heaved away to the leg side
short ball. It was slower and Mashrafe looks to pull it. He is in no control of that shot and gets a top edge that is held by the fielder at short fine leg
advances down the ground early and hammers this full delivery through extra cover
comes down the ground again and drills it through covers. Sweeper cover gets to the ball quickly but Mahmudullah charges back for the second and easily beats the throw from the deep
slower ball, miscues the drive and takes one hand off the bat as he completes the shot
good length on off, gets his front leg out of the way and pulls it between long-on and deep midwicket. Rushes back for the second again

inn2.comm: movement straight away. Gets it to jag away after landing on the good length area. Shahzad sticks his bat out and is beaten
short of a length, angled in, tucked away to fine leg
fuller ball, straightens late and Shahzad watchfully plays it to covers
fuller ball, looks to flick it away and gets an inside on to the boot
squared up, Shahzad sticks his bat out from the crease and gets an outside edge to point
late away movement again, but Shahzad manages to dab it to point
goes for a yorker but fires it way down the leg side, brilliant take by the keeper who dives to his left and collects it
stays in the crease and stabs it to point. No run there
good length ball that seams away outside off, Mangal takes a bold stride forward and blocks it back to the bowler
short of a length, slashes outside off and is beaten
full and very wide outside off, doesn't move his feet much but lurches forward and manages to cream it through covers
full and outside off, stands tall and punches to mid-off
walks across early and sticks his bat out but it is brilliantly bowled. Shapes away late after landing on the good length area and hisses past the outside edge. Beaten

beautifully bowled! He thoroughly deserved that wicket. Shahzad didn't move his feet and pays the price but that's not to take anything away from the delivery. It was full outside off and nips back in late. Shahzad looks to work across the line without moving his feet and leavs a big gap between bat and pad. The ball sneaks through that gap and crashes into the stumps
greets the new batsman with a full ball that moves away late, nudged to midwicket
angling in to the leg side, looks to flick it away but ti bounces more than he anticipates and is struck on the pads. Heading down leg
good length ball, straightening late, tucked away to midwicket
fuller ball outside off, no movement this time and it holds its line, defended to covers
loads up and delivers the final ball of the over despite the discomfort. It's full and outside off, driven straight to covers
pitches it up and the batsman closes the face of his bat early as he looks to flick it away, gets a leading edge to the off side
good length, angled in, straightening after it lands, defended back to the bowler
short of a length on the stumps, tucked away to midwicket
short of a length outside off, defended to mid-on
very full and on the pas, clipped away to deep midwicket
nips back in late. It's on a length and the batsman is forward pushing at it. The ball sneaks past the inside edge
length ball on off, defended back to the bowler
defended to covers off the backfoot
wide gap between bat and pad. Presses forward to push this fuller ball through covers and gets an inside edge as the ball goes to square leg
good length outside off, just keeps a bit low and the batsman gets an inside edge on the push and the ball goes to midwicket
fuller ball that comes back in from outside off, bounces more than he anticipates and he gets an inside edge on the front foot push
lovely drive through long-on. It's full and angling into leg stump, Mangal gets forward and pushes it gently along the carpet. Gets it well wide of the fielder at mid-on
defended from the crease back to the bowler
driven on the up to covers. Fielders there guarding the region, so no run there
gets forward and checks his push to cover-point
punched off the backfoot to the off side
gets big on him from the good length area but he is able to suss it out and run it down to third man
tries to open the face of his bat and gets a mild outside edge as the ball runs down to third man
floated up outside off, gets forward and drives, misfield at cover allows the single to be taken
loopy delivery, drifting in, tries to bring his bat down but wears it on the pad and the ball runs away to fine leg, would have definitely missed leg
comes down the ground and defends, gets an inside edge to square leg
slower through the air and straighter, left alone outside off
tucked behind square
drags his length back and offers width, backs away and cuts but can't pierce cover
full and angling in to the pads, pushes it to mid-on who dives and fields. But he pushes the ball away as he dives and they take the run before mid-off can gather it
pitched up, holding its line outside off, driven firmly to cover
jumps up in th crease to ride the bounce before dabbing it to midwicket
short of a length, looks to cut but it isn't wide enough and he chops the shot on to the ground before point runs in and fields it
beauty! Good length, angled in, holds its line, stays in the crease and looks to punch it but the ball beats him as it moves back in late

dropped. That was short of a length and moved back in late, so the attempted slap gets a thick outside edge. It flies through to the keeper who doesn't exactly get it at a comfortable height. Leaps up but can't latch on to it
floated up, driven uppishly through covers
floated up outside off, taps it from the crease through covers. Fielder runs back and fumbles slightly but they don't take the second run as they jog through for the first
pitched up outside off and turning away, gets forward and leaves it

fetches the sweep from outside off and the ball runs away to the backward square leg boundary. Two fielders give it a chase and they can't make up their mind about who puts in the slide and cuts it off. They end up clumsily pulling it back
defended on the front foot to the bowler
moves a long way across and slaps it to covers. No run there
flat and pushd through quicker, left alone outside off
flatter trajectory again, punched to long-off
slightly short, turning away sharply this time, slaps it but can't beat the fielder at cover
tries to make room and cut but chops it into the turf as the ball goes to point
entices him with a flighted ball, driven uppishly to long-off

lucky boundary. It was flat and quick and he looks to back away and cut. It wasn't wide enough and he is cramped for room. Gets an outside edge and the slip was just taken off. The ball races away to the third man boundary
floats a length ball on off stump, defended
works it off his wrists to deep midwicket and jogs across for a single
chases a wide ball, but pulls out right at the very end. Lucky he didn't bottom edge the delivery which was way outside off
stays inside the crease to turn the incoming delivery to the leg side
looks to scamper a run by tapping that towards midwicket,  but Rahmat wasn't keen
punched down the ground to mid-on, the fielder was at the edge of the ring to allow them the run
driven back down the pitch, Mashrafe stops it on his follow-through
pushed through quicker on middle from around the stumps, pushed to cover
inside-edges a drive to mid-on, looked to hit it too hard that time
is made to stretch out a long way to defend that delivery
nearly sneaked through. Looks to drive, he was playing outside the line of that arm-ball, saved by an inside-edge
makes a bit of room and slaps the short ball to sweeper cover for an easy single
forced into the gap between cover and mid-off, sensible stuff this. The boundaries aren't coming, but they are milking the singles easily at the moment to keep the scorecard ticking along

banged in short from wide of the crease, punched down the ground. Looked like there was one for sure, but that was quelled by Mashrafe, who dived full length across the pitch to effect a one-handed stop
plenty of oooohs and aaaahs with that. The ball was lobbed back over Mashrafe's outstretched right hand. Mangal played way too early and got it off the top half of the bat
worked wide of square leg to bring up the half-century

gives him the charge and hits through the line to elude the cover fielder. Was nowhere near the pitch of the ball but he still bravely went through with the stroke, on the bounce to the boundary rider
looks to play a cut but that ball kept a touch low to beat the inside edge
stands tall and punches the back of length delivery to cover
slow turn from middle, Rahmat check-drives to cover
touch short with a hint of width, punched to deep point

it can't get more plumb than that, the comeback man has a wicket, and it is a big one too!  He shapes to play a sweep across the line, but the ball was pushed through quickly and it kept coming back in to hit him flush on the pad. That would have crashed into middle. Mangal knew he was trapped the moment the ball hit the pad. The umpire didn't take long to raise the finger either. All the elements of a typical left-arm spinner's wicket there. Drift, the angle and a hint of turn. So lovely to watch.
snakes back in to take an inside edge to square leg
slides across the batsman who pushes it to the cover fielder

the age old saying of 'one brings two' holds good most times, doesn't it?  This was a poor, poor stroke. Looks to sweep, but this time there's plenty of bounce on that tossed up delivery on middle which takes the top edge and lobs to Tamim, who takes a dolly at short fine leg.
worked off his hip, just falls short of short fine leg

did he get a nick on that? There was a definite sound as the ball passed the bat. Phew, not sure what that was. Mushfiqur didn't go up in an appeal either as Rahmat looked to glide that down to third man. Extra bounce.
angles it fuller on middle from wide of the crease, driven to mid-off
no feet movement whatsoever as he looks to flay that on the up over cover, beaten comprehensively.  Could have easily nicked that
firm push, but straight to mid-off.  Maiden over
driven inside-out to long-off as they amble a single
excellent stop off his own bowling, throwing himself to his right to stop a certain single
drops it towards short cover, single refused
steps out but can't get to the pitch, check-pushes that to point
a misfield at cover gives them a single. This was hit hard off the back foot, Shakib the culprit, ran in a little too early and tried to throw even before gathering the ball
slides back in to take the inside edge on a forward defense
starts off with a back of length delivery outside off, glided down to third man
tried to slap that between cover and point, but the delivery was too full for him to try that. He was camping back too, and so he had no option but to throw his hands at that. Beaten

wonder if Shakib's misfield in the previous over played a part in him trying to chance a single again. He tapped it and took off for the run, but this time, the superstar was quick to move to his left, pick up the ball with his left hand and fire a throw in a single motion. Stanikzai was comfortably short of the crease. Afghanistan in real trouble
opens the face of the bat and runs it down to third man
Mosaddek stops that back foot punch at backward point, threw himself to his left prevent the single
late on the forward defense, the ball thudded onto the top half of his bat as he pressed forward
steps out and works it with the angle to long-on
gentle dab towards cover for a quick single
makes a bit of room and punches it straight to cover
this time he splits the gap between cover and point. It was a touch short, and he had enough time to makes some room and cut that this time
slider on middle, Shenwari just manages to get his bat down in time to defend
stabs forward, gets an inside edge that rolls to midwicket
beauty from Taskin. Gets the ball to deviate a wee bit from length outside off, Rahmat looks to play from the crease and nearly paid the price. Didn't miss the edge by much
friendly half-volley on the pads, he leans forward, closes the bat face to neatly flick that into the midwicket boundary. Sweet timing.  First boundary in 8.2 overs
gets on top of the bounce and runs it down to square third man, they complete it quite comfortably
knuckle ball, was it? Slowed down considerably. It was a touch short and deviated just a wee bit from the good length area, Rahmat is beaten
slower bouncer outside off this time, Rahmat is beaten as he looks to get on top of the bounce and play it over point
behind the line of that incoming short ball, played with soft hands
stretches forward and blocks
leans forward to keep off that tossed up ball on off stump
plays a switch hit to deep point. So much risk for a single. He tried it hit it behind square, but couldn't get the direction
short outside off, crunched to deep point
in-drifter on middle, Shenwari gets to the pitch of the ball and smothers the spin
steered wide of cover for an easy single
angles a length ball into middle, he gets across the stumps and whips it off his hip to deep square leg
punched off the back foo to point
edged and down to third man where Mosharraf makes a tumbling stop. Played away from the body and was late on the back foot punch which would have flown straight into the hands of the slip fielder
defends a full ball back down the pitch
juicy half-volley on the pads that has been flicked straight to deep square leg
gets on top of the bounce and plays a short-arm jab wide of midwicket
beaten in flight as he drives, gets a thick edge to short third man
worked to the on side, wide of midwicket
slides back into middle, punched to cover
pushes outside the line of the delivery, gets a thick inside edge onto the pad
cuts hard, but the point fielder does well to pull off a one-handed half-stop at point
driven back to the bowler with the spin

that should break the shackles. It is a terrific hit. Enough width on offer, too short as well and Shenwari gets onto his toes and plays an uppish cut over point. Was in total control. They need more of those
floats a yorker-length delivery on middle, squeezed to mid-off where Mahmudullah fails to effect a clean pick-up and throw at the bowler's end.
gets the line wrong, looks for the yorker but slips it down leg, keeper does well to move low to his left to stop it with his left glove
didn't get to the pitch but went through with the drive and managed to ease it down to the man at sweeper cover
does well to get on top of that short ball and fend it to the off side

done in by the short ball which reared up on Shenwari. He tried to hook but got himself into an awkward tangle and could only manage a glove on the way through to Mushfiqur Rahim. The ball deviated back in a long way to cramp up Shenwari, which also played a part in the dismissal.
excellent short ball to follow-up, but Nabi sways out the way without any hassle
firm push off the front foot to wide long-off
driven down the ground to long-off, easing it quite comfortably with the spin
slider into middle and leg, punched wide of cover, a misfield gave them a single
driven inside-out to wide long-off, it was tossed up nicely and he got underneath the flight nicely
a misfield at mid-on can't prevent the single
gives it a lot of air but the ball doesn't turn much as it drifts into middle, punched to cover
gets this to swerve away late, but Rahmat is behind the line of that full ball as he blocks
super yorker that nearly sneaked through. Rahmat just managed to get underneath that in the nick of time and get half a bat on that

the short ball has sucker punched Rahmat, who was peppered with yorkers. This one was dug in short outside off, Rahmat looks to pull - made it look like he was playing a cross court forehand - but the ball got big on him to take the top edge that was easily pouched at midwicket. Rahmat's feet were off the ground when he made contact with that ball. With positions like those, you're unlikely to be in control of too many short deliveries. More so in this case as he had to fetch it from way outside off.
plays it wide of cover and jogs across for an easy single
gets on top of the bounce and defends to the off side
looks to snake a yorker in, but it turns out to be a full-length ball which is squeezed to mid-off
ball stops on him as he tries to punch it past mid-on, rolls to the fielder there
gets a good stride in to block
is made to reach out a long way forward, defended back to the bowler
pushed back to the bowler

gentle lob back to the bowler. Nabi was completely deceived in flight as he chipped down the track. He was looking to work it across the line but ended up spooning a dolly. The end is near for Afghanistan. What a comeback this is turning out to be for Mosharraf
stabs forward and is saved by an inside-edge to that in-drifter. Would have been plumb in front of middle had he missed that.
yorker-length delivery outside off, Zadran is late to get down on the ball as he looks to squeeze it behind point
gets on top of the bounce and chops it behind the stumps
solidly behind the line of that incoming delivery, defended to the off side
misfield at cover gives away a run, Sabbir took his eyes off the ball as it rolled to him.  First run in 11 deliveries

delightful cut shot. Width on offer, and he simply stand and delivers. Flayed off the back foot into the gap between cover and point. Didn't bounce as much as Taskin wanted, Rashid was deep inside the crease anyway to play the stroke.
drives a full toss straight to mid-off
slow turn back into middle and leg, defended
bounce, this one drifts in to take the shoulder of the bat and lob to the on side
blocked off the back foot
top shot! Gets to the pitch of the ball and lofts it against the turn over wide long-off. Delightful timing
turned wide of midwicket for an easy single
too full and wide outside off, slapped to the long-off fielder for an easy single
looks to arch back to guide it over point, but the ball didn't bounce as much as Rashid wanted it to for him to play that shot
driven, but straight to extra cover
shapes to play an upper cut, but can't get any bat on that
this was a hit me ball. Short and there was enough room for him to slap that over backward point
crunched to the man at deep point. Threw everything he had at that
nearly chopped on. Pushed away from the body, but only managed a thick inside edge onto the pad
cuts it but straight to point
gets forward and defends to the off side
tossed up outside off, gets forward and comfortably defends to the off side
shorter and flatter, backs away and chops the cut into the ground
fuller and pushed through slightly quicker, presses forward and pushes to mid-off
floated up outside off, eased down to wide long-off
short of a length on the stumps, defended from the crease to the left of the bowler
short ball and width on offer, rocks back and slaps it hard, gets it well over the leaping point fielder
beaten. Short of a length, sticks his bat out and is beaten

dropped! It was back of a length and he pushed at it with hard hands off the backfoot. Gets a healthy outside edge that carries comfortably to first slip where Soumya Sarkar spills a straightforward catch
short and wide, slapped uppishly and the ball goes on the bounce to third man
what a hit! That was full and outside off, right in the slot for Najibullah who hammers it over long-on. That is as clean a hit as you will see
loopy delivery that is angled down to leg and turns away sharply, gets it away to short third man after opening the face of his bat
presses forward and defends to point
goes for a reverse sweep and is struck on the pad. Appeal for lbw but the impact was outside off. Actually, it hits him on the forearm
comes down the track and clears long-on with the turn
defended back to the bowler
comes down the track and launches it clean over long-off. Some powerful strikes in that over!

pitched up outside off and gets forward and taps it to point. They take off for a quick single though it goes directly to him. Direct hit at the non-striker's end and the umpire takes a long time before deciding to go upstairs. Looks like he is safe initially, but replays show that he out of his crease by more than a mile. Direct hits are always close and this one showed why. The third umpire presses the wrong button and the crowd is stunned momentarily but the big screen flashes the right decision eventually

both halves of the partnership have now been dismissed. It was floated up and on off,  tempted him to go for a big drive and that is exactly what the batsman does, only that he gets a big outside edge that is snaffled at first slip. Bangladesh one wicket away from their 100th ODI win
full and outside off, presses forward and looks to defend but that kept really low, almost rolled along to the wicketkeeper who fails to collect it cleanly
tucked behind square on the leg side
fired down the leg side and called a wide
comes forward and defends back to the bowler
width on offer and it keeps low but Ashraf manages to cut it away square of the wicket to the boundary
short of a length outside off, jumps back in his crease to ride the bounce and bunts it back to the bowler
short and wide, looks to slap it and misses
short of a length, angling in, keeps a tad low but Dawlat manages to keep it out to midwicket off the backfoot
fires it on the pads, clipped away to midwicket

slower ball, doesn't pick it up. Tries to go big over long-off and does not get enough on it. He is undone by the lack of pace on that delivery, the shot doesn't carry too far. The bowler runs back and holds on to it
